title: BBC Local Live: Cambridgeshire - BBC News
summary: peterborough-based hotpoint issue fridge freezer notice after grenfell fire .
women accosted on guided busway path .
work to repair sinkhole still ongoing .
mp raises peterborough gridlock in commons .

documents.title: goodbye
text: that 's the end of our live updates for cambridgeshire .
we 'll be back at 08:00 on monday .
have a good weekend .

documents.title: evening forecast : overcast night
text: it 'll be a rather cloudy night with an odd spot of rain and moderate west to south westerly winds .
it 'll be mild with temperatures falling to around 15c ( 59f ) .
saturday will remain rather cloudy , with some very patchy light rain in the morning .
a few bright or sunny spells should eventually develop and there may be a few afternoon showers too .
there 'll be a mainly moderate south-westerly wind and highs around 23c ( 73f ) .
author: Julie Reinger
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: mayor salary to be more than mp
text: it 's been recommended that the salary for the new mayor of cambridgeshire and peterborough is set at £ 75,000 .
an mp 's base salary is just under that , at £ 74,900 .
the amount needs to be approved by the combined authority next week .
conservative james palmer says he appreciates it 's a lot of money , but will `` prove he is worth it over the next four years '' .

documents.title: bradford sign taylor after posh exit
text: bradford sign taylor after posh exit

documents.title: former police station bought by whittlesey council
text: a deal to allow whittlesey town council to buy a former police station in the town has been approved .
the building was vacated by the police in august 2016 as part of a restructure , with officers relocated to march .
in a sale supported by the police and crime commissioner ( pcc ) jason ablewhite , the redundant building will be retained as a town and community asset .
the decision to approve the sale of the freehold interest to the council was approved yesterday at the commissioner 's strategic board .
mr ablewhite said it was `` important that the building was retained following the decision that it was not required as part of the operational police estate .
`` therefore it seemed only natural to progress conversations with whittlesey town council . ''
ralph butcher , mayor of whittlesey , added : `` as soon as the whittlesey town council knew the police station was going to be closed we discussed the possibility of purchasing the property .
`` this giving whittlesey town council an asset , right in the centre of the town , easily accessible to residents and in the long run will be more financially beneficial to our ratepayers . ''
author: Adam Jinkerson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: money raised to help restore fire-damaged mg
text: friends of a cambridgeshire man have raised nearly £ 800 towards the restoration of his late father 's classic car after it was almost totally destroyed in an arson attack last week .
thieves tried to steal charles thomson 's 1964 mg from a garage in cambridge , but they could n't start the engine , so set fire to it instead , police said .
the car also has additional sentimental value , as mr thomson and his wife used it as their wedding car .
author: Adam Jinkerson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: memorial to be built for tiger attack victim rosa king
text: an appeal to build a memorial at hamerton zoo park for keeper rosa king has reached its target .
the 33-year-old died last month when she was attacked by one of the tigers .
an online appeal has reached its £ 1,800 target .
any surplus donations will go to the cheetah conservation foundation , organisers say .
details of the memorial have not been announced .
the zoo reopened last week following a safety inspection .

documents.title: hotpoint fridge freezer notice after grenfell fire
text: peterborough-based hotpoint has issued a `` product notice '' about some of its fridge freezers after police confirmed the fire which destroyed grenfell tower in london started in one of its models .
seventy-nine people are feared dead after the blaze destroyed 151 homes in the kensington tower block on 14 june .
the government has ordered immediate testing of the hotpoint fridge freezer that was involved .

hotpoint , which has its headquarters in peterborough , is urging anyone who has a white hotpoint fridge freezer model number ff175bp or graphite fridge freezer model number ff175bg to register their appliance with the manufacturer to receive any updates .

`` we have been made aware of a possible incident involving a hotpoint branded fridge freezer , manufactured between march 2006 and july 2009 , model numbers ff175bp ( white ) and ff175bg ( graphite ) , '' the company says on its website .
if you 've got one , you can get further details by clicking here .

documents.title: women accosted on guided busway path
text: two women were accosted by a man who jumped out of bushes as they walked along the guided busway path near cambridge .
police said the women , in their 20s and 30s , were walking along the stretch between king 's hedges and impington at about 22:35 last night .
the man attempted to grab hold of them both before making threats to harm them .
they managed to break free and run home .
the man is described as black , aged 30-40 and approximately 5ft 10in ( 1.8m ) tall .
he had a short beard and was wearing dark trousers and a dark hoodie .
police have asked anyone with information , or who saw the incident , to contact them on 101 or crimestoppers , anonymously , on 0800 555 111 .

documents.title: nurse dismissed over lack of english
text: nurse dismissed over lack of english

documents.title: your grey skies in the county
text: well we 're certainly not seeing the same summer weather we 've been experiencing over the past few days .
however , that does n't stop our bbc weather watchers from getting out and about , capturing the sights from around the county
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: dashcam captures drink-drive crash
text: dashcam captures drink-drive crash

documents.title: 'corpse flower ' named by online poll
text: the twitter poll to name the titan arum at the botanic garden in cambridge has ended .
the flower is set to bloom some time in the next seven days .
and the winner is titus !
the plant is one of two based at the garden and only flowers every few years .
it 's said to produce the `` stench of rotting flesh '' when it blooms .
the second plant flowered back in 2015 , attracting thousands of visitors .
help us name our # titanarum # amorphophallustitanum before it flowers !
vote for your fave now and please share !

it 's another .
'tiny ' flowered in 2015 ; this one last flowered in 2004 !
titus

documents.title: work to repair sinkhole still ongoing
text: there 's still a lane closure in place on newmarket road in cambridge , as anglia water continues to fix a sinkhole that appeared earlier in the week .
we 're expecting an update on the progress of the repair soon .
traffic is diverting on to the bus lane as a result of the closure .
author: Adam Jinkerson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: funding deal expected for new university
text: funding of £ 6.5m is expected to be agreed next week to accelerate plans for a new university of peterborough .
cambridgeshire and peterborough 's new metro mayor james palmer has allocated the funding as a priority , since being elected last month .
the project aims to transform the university centre peterborough , which is currently under the umbrella of anglia ruskin university , into a fully-fledged university of peterborough .
the funding will be used over the next three years to increase student numbers from 800 to 3,000 , and expanding the curriculum on offer .
mr palmer said the university was `` about opportunity '' .

`` if there 's people living in peterborough and in the surrounding area that want to go university and they 're not getting the chance at the moment , i know it 's doing a good job , '' he told bbc radio cambridgeshire .
`` we know that where a city has a university , it brings up the economy of the city .
it 's more than just education , it 's what the university brings to a city .
`` we 've been given £ 600m from the government so we can raise money from that , as well as from elsewhere .
`` i 'm committed to this university .
i think it 's very important . ''

documents.title: mp raises peterborough gridlock in commons
text: the woes of peterborough drivers earlier this week were raised in parliament yesterday by the mp for north west cambridgeshire .
roadworks which shut the entry slip road on to the a1 at junction 17 caused gridlock around the city , with drivers using other routes as diversions - causing further delays .
shailesh vara told the commons that it was `` down to a decision by highways england '' .
`` that decision was taken by highways england without any consultation to local stakeholders , with inadequate notice to motorists and with ill regard for a diverted route , '' he said .
mr vara called on the transport secretary to ensure the agency acted `` in the best interests of the community rather than unilaterally '' .
author: Adam Jinkerson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : cloudy and cool but remaining mostly dry
text: dry , cloudy and breezy with a few sunny spells possible throughout the day .
it 's going to feel cooler and fresher than in recent days .
maximum temperature : 22c ( 72f )
more details from bbc weather .
author: Elizabeth Rizzini
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: drink-driver 's 'deplorable level of intoxication '
text: keith howlett , 60 and from wisbech , was killed in the five-vehicle pile-up caused by stephen james in december .
his wife joy said the family was devastated : `` he went out to work that morning happy , smiling and looking forward to christmas with his family but never came back . ''
pc james thorne said james was due to start work at 06:00
`` running late and compounded due to his deplorable level of intoxication , he made the decision to overtake a lorry in a place which was wholly inappropriate . ''
james was sentenced to six years for death by dangerous driving and to two years for causing serious injury by dangerous driving , to serve concurrently .
he pleaded guilty to the charges at peterborough crown court .

documents.title: drink-driver in five vehicle fatal crash jailed for six years
text: a drink-driver who killed a man in a five-vehicle crash has been jailed for six years .
stephen james , 47 , from parkside in haverhill , pleaded guilty to death by dangerous driving and causing serious injury by dangerous driving at peterborough crown court .

he was on his way to work on the a142 at mepal at 05:58 on 20 december when he overtook an articulated lorry , collided with a traffic island , crashed into a car and caused the lorry to hit a third car .
james was two and a half times over the drink drive limit at the time of the crash .

documents.title: not long left to name 'corpse flower '
text: there are only two hours left to decide the name of the flowering titan arum at cambridge university botanic garden .
the smell of the plant in bloom has been likened to that of rotting flesh .
the plant has been growing fast over the past few days , with the latest measurement showing it standing at 125.8cm ( 49.5in ) tall - a growth of 5.8cm ( 2.3in ) from yesterday .
here 's the latest shot from the webcam

documents.title: local writer wins third book award
text: cambridgeshire author francis spufford has won another major book prize for his first novel .
the ely writer up the desmond elliott prize , along with £ 10,000 , for `` golden hill '' .

set in new york in 1746 , when the sprawling metropolis was just a small town on the tip of manhattan island , it tells the story of mr smith , a mysterious young man who steps off a boat from england with an order for an enormous sum of money .
mr spufford , 53 , told bbc radio cambridgeshire he was `` delighted '' .
`` i feel a little bit of a fraud as a first novelist since i 'm so old to be writing one for the first time , '' he said .
`` this is wildly better than the biggest daydream i 'd even dared to have about it . ''
the prize makes it a hat trick for the ely author , who also won the costa first novel award and the ondaatje prize for the same book .

documents.title: peterborough mp makes first commons intervention
text: peterborough 's newly elected labour mp has challenged the prime minister for more information on the cladding used on the grenfell tower .
fiona onasanya , who took the seat from the conservatives in the general election earlier this month , questioned theresa may over whether it met building regulations .
`` the question that 's being raised with the pm is whether or not the cladding was compliant , '' ms onasanya told the commons .
`` are you advising us that it needs to be tested before you can reply to that question ? ''
the pm says tests on a number of high-rise flats after the grenfell tower fire have shown some of the cladding material to be `` combustible '' .
mrs may says steps are being taken to inform residents and make buildings safe .
author: Adam Jinkerson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: rail ticket machines hit by it glitch
text: rail ticket machines across the uk fell out of service this morning , preventing travellers from using them to pay fares .
it affected thameslink , southern rail and greater anglia services .
thameslink said : `` the problem is now fixed and all our machines are able to accept credit cards .
`` anyone who was unable to buy a ticket as a result of the problem will not be penalised . ''
customers were still able to buy tickets online via the web and apps .
author: BBC Technology

documents.title: guided bus crashes into wall
text: a guided bus crashed after leaving the tracks close to addenbrooke 's hospital yesterday .
author: Adam Jinkerson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: witness appeal following fail-to-stop crash
text: police are looking for the driver of a silver renault clio following a collision in welney .
the vehicle had collided with a bicycle on the a1101 , on the welney side of the suspension bridge .
as a result , the bike then hit another cycle .
the renault driver did n't stop at the scene and drove off towards wisbech .
both the cyclists , a boy in his teens and a man in his early 20s , were taken to the queen elizabeth hospital in king 's lynn with leg injuries .
anyone with information is asked to contact norfolk police .

documents.title: speed restrictions in place around bus crash site
text: investigation work is continuing on the guided busway in cambridge , after a bus crashed when it left the track yesterday .
the go whippet service came off the tracks between addenbrooke 's hospital and cambridge train station at about 16:00 .
the track was blocked for nearly five hours , reopening at 20:45 , with a speed restriction in place close to where the incident happened .
author: Adam Jinkerson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'serious injury ' in crash near stamford
text: there 's been a `` serious '' crash near stamford and the road is currently blocked .
serious injury collision barnack road stanford .
pls take alternative route .

cluster of thunderstorms now moving east north eastwards through cambs into norfolk and suffolk @ twitterid

# stuffloadingintovan

documents.title: sinkhole opens in cambridge
text: a sinkhole opened up on one of the main roads in and out of cambridge yesterday afternoon .
it closed one lane along newmarket road .
police closed the road , with drivers having to use the bus lane as a diversion .
we 've got a call into highways england to see if the road is open today .
author: David Webster
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: 'time to look at nhs pay ' , says mp
text: south cambridgeshire mp heidi allen used her appearance on bbc two 's newsnight last night to say that she would be for a tax increase to give workers in the public sector a pay rise .
you can watch the clip below
conservative mp @ twitterid says she 'd be `` potentially '' willing to see a tax rise to pay for public services # newsnight
heidi allen is a very unusual tory politican .
seemingly open , honest and does not parrot the party line .
an honest tory politician ?
have you met fred , my pet unicorn ?
i recognise that donkey
love heidi allen she 's so compassionate and wise , unlike the rest of the party .
much better than many , but still supports many tory regressive policies :
aware of that but she 's prepared to seek cross-party support on issues .
no need for a tax rise , just vote labour , they have a magic money tree
i see heidi often totally contradicting the tory party line .
not trying to be intentionally inflammatory but y exactly is she in the party ?
because it got her a safe tory seat in her local area .
and yet she has never voted against the regressive policies of the tory party .
so tories push their 'we 're a low tax party ' to win the votes .
when in want to raise taxes after mocking @ twitterid to dare suggest it .
mmmm
glad foxhunting is now completely out of the manifesto .
a tax rise for the 1 % labour say .
do not punish the innocent 99 % any more
tax rise with no reduction in overseas aid budget will see corbyn pm
the kind and caring @ twitterid who have been decimating public service and outsourcing to reduce democratic control for private profit
author: BBC Newsnight

documents.title: busway section to remain closed after crash
text: the south section of the guided busway in cambridge is expected to stay closed until 11:00 , say council officials , after a bus crashed yesterday afternoon .
the ambulance service says it was called just before 16:00 to the track between cambridge railway station and addebrooke 's hospital .
a man in his 50s , believed to be the driver , was taken to hospital .
no passengers were hurt .
at the scene yesterday , campbell ross bain from cambridgeshire county council , said : `` all the buses will be running , but they 'll have to divert round this route . ''
author: Sam Edwards
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: weather the heatwave is coming to a close
text: if it 's been too hot for you , then good news at last .
the heatwave will end today .
most places will stay dry and bright , but there could be a few thunderstorms around - heavy at times .
temperatures peaking at 23c ( 73f ) .
weather has a more localised forecast for where you live .

BBC Look East weather

i 'm off home to put my feet in the paddling pool ( if my daughter lets me that is ) .

BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : warm and dry with potential for thundery rain
text: we 've got another very warm sunny evening ahead .
staying dry for most this evening and overnight but with a risk of thunderstorms developing later .
where they do occur there is potential for heavy downpours bringing sudden localised flooding and disruption to power supplies from lightning strikes .
lows of 18c ( 64f ) .
tomorrow will see more risk of a thundery shower first thing but it will become drier and brighter and feel much fresher .
highs of 25c ( 77f ) .
weather has more local forecasts .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: breakingman injured in busway crash
text: a bus has crashed after coming off the guided busway in cambridge .
the ambulance service says it was called to clifton way near the station just before 15:50 .
a man in his 50s is being treated at the scene .
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: watch : see how it grows !
text: as we 've just explained , the titan arum gets big very quickly .
it 's already more than 120cm ( 47in ) tall and it has n't finished growing yet .
to see how much it 's grown you can watch this time palse video below .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: nose pegs poised for pongy plant
text: breaths are quite literally being held in cambridge at the moment , as the botanic gardens is waiting patiently for a rare plant to bloom .
it 's hoped the titan arum could flower early next week , and when it does , it will emit an extremely disgusting smell , hence why it 's got the nickname , the corpse flower .
despite the horrendous odors , scores of visitors are expected to flock to the tourist attraction as two years ago when it 's sister plant 'tiny ' flowered , about 13,000 people came to see it .
at the moment the titan has gown 6cm ( 2.4in ) overnight and now measures 120cm ( 47in ) tall with a girth of 78.2cm ( 31in ) and is getting bigger all the time !
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: just bumbling along !
text: someone 's been a busy bee today , as this beautiful by bbc weather watcher alpaca lady shows , where temperatures have hit 30c ( 86f ) in ramsey saint marys .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: 'heat wave ' affecting bin collections in cambridgeshire
text: cambridge city council has defended its record on bin collections , nearly four months on from a change in collection rounds .
in february cambridge city council and south cambridgeshire disctrict council came together to run services , aimed at saving money and reducing bin collection miles .
on monday , 11 roads did n't have black bins emptied .
damien tunnacliffe , the shadow waste spokesman for the liberal democrats in cambridge , claims the service is n't good enough .
rosy moore , the labour executive councillor for environmental services and city centre , says they `` expected there to be problems '' but the issues this week were due to the `` heat wave '' .
she says the service is `` getting better '' and changes needed to be made to make it `` more effective '' .
author: Sam Edwards
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: looking back at lido 's 80 years
text: looking back at lido 's 80 years

that 's what grant mccann , the peterborough united manager , told me when he found out this morning that the posh are at home for their first game of the 2017/18 season .
here 's my interview with him :
`` it 's not rochdale so we 're quite pleased ! ''
grant mccann on peterborough 's opening day match against plymouth
do like rochdale away but not first game every season glad it 's a home start this season
author: Nick Fairbairn
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire sport

documents.title: caravan and car overturns on a1
text: luckily no one was hurt when a car towing a caravan overturned and ended up on the side of the a1 northbound , close to peterborough .
two patients were assessed by the east of england ambulance service , but were uninjured .
earlier , there was some congestion between junctions 16 ( yaxley ) and 17 ( peterborough ) , but the road is now beginning to get back to normal .
author: Emma Maclean
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: travel : delays easing on m11
text: all lanes have no reopened on the m11 by junction 11 after a car overturned earlier .

the east of england ambulance service has just told me that they were called at 11:29 and dispatched two ambulance crews , the hazardous area response team , an ambulance officer , and an air ambulance from the east anglian air ambulance .
two people were treated at the scene , one for serious injuries and one with serious but not life-threatening injuries .
both were taken to addenbrooke 's hospital via land ambulances for further treatment .
following an earlier collision all lanes are now open # m11 northbound between j13 + j14 delays from j12 are easing .
thanks for your patience
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: listen : doggett on the season ahead for cambridge united
text: cambridge united chairman dave doggett says the team might have to `` leave a bit early '' to get to exeter on time for their first game of the season , on 5 august , which is right in the middle of holiday season .
have a listen to him talking to me about the 2017/18 season by clicking the link below :

documents.title: travel : car overturns in m11 crashcambs
text: the occupants of a car are in a serious but stable condition after an earlier crash on the m11 by junction 13 .
the emergency services were called after a car overturned .
the road was closed , but one lane has now reopened .
police are now waiting for the car to be recovered .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : m11 closed j13 north
text: the m11 northbound is closed by junction 13 , at madingley after a serious collision and an over-turned vehicle .
there are queues back to just beyond junction 12 for barton .
police are at the scene .
we are dealing with a road traffic collision on the m11 at junction 13 on the north bound carriageway .
the road is currently closed .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: making a splash at peterborough lido
text: today is set to be even hotter than yesterday , so people all over cambridgeshire are trying many different things to keep cool .
one way of beating the predicted 31c ( 88f ) temperatures is to take a lucky dip in the peterborough lido .
i 'm here reporting live for bbc radio cambridgeshire and it 's filling up nicely .
let us know how you are keeping cool by sending us a tweet using # cmblive , facebook or email .
author: Paul Stainton
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: racing driver out of coma
text: cambridgeshire motor racing driver luke davenport is out of an induced coma .

he 's been in a serious but stable condition in a middlesbrough hospital for almost two weeks , since a crash on 10 june during qualifying for round 13 of the dunlop msa british touring car championship ( btcc ) at croft
a statement released last night confirmed he 's now `` conscious and communicating '' .
his family say : `` luke is getting much better .
a huge thank you to everyone who has been in touch , it 's really helped us as family to support him through this difficult time .
`` we have received cards and well wishes from the marshals , fans , extrication crew , medical staff , btcc drivers , sponsors , staff and fans .
we 've even had messages from teams in lemans , mexico city and new zealand . ''
`` the btcc is a big family and we 're very grateful for the support , '' they added .
author: Sam Edwards
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: the count down starts to the football season
text: if you want to read the full fixtures lists for cambridge united and peterborough united , you can get them by clicking on the clubs names .
a countdown clock is already up and running on the websites of both clubs .
fixtures : united head to exeter city on opening day - full 2017/18 schedule available to view at
any chance of a electronic calendar upload please ?

BBC Radio Cambridgeshire sport

documents.title: breakingpeterborough united fixture highlights
text: so we already know how cambridge united start their 2017/18 season , so now it 's the turn of peterborough united .
it all starts for them on 05 august , when they are at home to plymouth argyle .
their first away game is on 12 august to bristol rovers .
and there 's a local derby against northampton town at sixfields on 26 august .
their boxing day feature is at bradford city and the final day of the season is away to portsmouth on 05 may .
author: Peter Swan
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire sport

documents.title: breakingcambridge united fixture highlights
text: the football league fixtures for 2017/18 have just been released .
cambridge united will play their first game of the season , away to exeter city on 5 august .
their first home game will be against carlisle united on 12 august .
their boxing day match is at home to barnet , and the final game of season will also be at home against port vale on 05 may .
we 'll bring you peterborough united 's highlights next .
author: Peter Swan
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire sport

documents.title: 'lessons learnt ' after a1 traffic delays
text: highways england say they 're putting extra resources on the a1 roadworks at peterborough after motorists experienced heavy delays this week .
the slip road joining the a1 south at peterborough services is closed , with traffic being diverted through hampton and yaxley on the a15 .
simon amor , the asset development manager for highways england , has `` apologised '' for the problems and says `` we will learn our lessons '' .
he explained that they 've already changed the way they work , have put up more signs , rescheduled the work , and suspended further road closures .
he added they will `` make sure it wo n't happen again '' and we will `` review the way we do the work '' .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : hottest day of the year expected
text: the heatwave is set to continue with inland temperatures set to reach 32c ( 89.6f ) .
it 's going to be a warm and sunny day , and the pollen levels are also set to be high .
author: Kate Kinsella
BBC Weather

documents.title: football league fixtures to be releasedcambs
text: there 's less than an hour to go before we find out who peterborough united and cambridge united are playing next season .
we 'll have bring you them as soon as we can .
peterborough and cambridge united will discover their 2017/18 league fixtures within the next hour

BBC Radio Cambridgeshire sport

we 'll be bringing you a full weather report shortly from kate kinsella , as well as all your news and travel .

our bbc weather watchers have been out and about capturing the sights

documents.title: from grass to glass : soham solar farm opens
text: one of the largest solar farms in the uk has opened in soham , stretching over seven fields and 70 acres .
author: Mike Cartwright
BBC Look East

documents.title: police experiencing 'exceptionally high numbers of 999 calls '
text: police say they are currently receiving `` exceptionally high numbers of calls to both 999 and 101 '' and are reminding people to only use the emergency numbers in the appropriate situation .
`` staff in our contact centres are working incredibly hard to reach the people in most need as soon as possible , '' the statement continues .
`` if the situation you are calling about is not an emergency , please consider reporting information online rather than dialling 101 .
we are currently receiving exceptionally high numbers of calls .
please only dial 999 in a genuine emergency .
author: Adam Jinkerson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: video : roads melt in hot weather
text: as we mentioned earlier , it 's been so hot over the past couple of days that roads around the county have been melting .
gritters have been out and about spraying granite dust to stop the surface from sticking to cars tyres .
agnes owen filmed this on the b1093 in doddington earlier today

documents.title: car and lorry crash on a14
text: a crash between a car and an hgv has closed one lane of the a14 eastbound between junction 23 and 24 near huntingdon .
the crash happened around 11:50 .
police say the car is on its roof , although only minor injuries have been reported .
expect delays if you 're heading that way .
# a14 1 lane clsd e/b btwn j23 and j24 due to a collision inv : a hgv and a car .
@ twitterid on scene .
delays building .
author: Adam Jinkerson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: webcam allows you to watch rare flower
text: you may have seen yesterday that we reported the titan arum , housed at the cambridge university botanic garden , is set to flower `` in the next week '' , according to garden staff .
the spike of the plant has grown 37cm ( 15in ) since the weekend , and now stands at 102cm ( 40in ) .
well now you can watch it flower live as a webcam has been set up .
here 's a peek from when i had a look a few minutes ago still not flowered !
back in 2015 , the second titan arum flowered , attracting more than 11,000 people to smell the `` noxious '' stench that accompanies it .
author: Adam Jinkerson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: gritters used to help melting roads
text: it may be an odd sight in the middle of summer , but the gritters are out and about on the roads .
it 's all to help with the roads that are melting around the county , including the b1093 and b1165 we mentioned earlier .
evan laughlin , from cambridgeshire county council , says that `` normally the roads can stand the temperatures '' .

`` they 're surface dressed roads and what 's happening is the binder that 's underneath the stone that you see is bleeding through - the heat is bringing it to the surface , '' he told bbc radio cambridgeshire .
`` we 're using the gritters to apply granite dust which settles it down and stops the bitumen material applying itself to the wheels of vehicles .
`` it 's very expensive to use other processes to resurface roads .
it 's a very good product that we use .
`` the road surface temperatures are at 40c ( 104f ) and above at midday .
normally the roads stand the summer temperatures we get , but just this week it 's very hot . ''
author: Adam Jinkerson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: roads 'melt ' in heatwave
text: cambridgeshire county council sent out gritters across the county yesterday , after several roads appeared to melt due to the heat .
fen cops tweeted from the b1093 , near doddington , saying `` please be aware the road is melting , highways have been called , approach with care '' .
it also tweeted a second from the b1165 little ramper , near wisbech , saying : `` road is starting to melt , please approach with care . ''
a third showed the gritter arriving to make the road safer
agnes owen , who had a road melt near to where she works at doddington service station , said that it `` sounded like cars were driving on water '' .
`` the tyres were literally ripping the tarmac off the road , '' she said .
`` it 's quite dangerous ! ''
temperatures are set to peak at around 30c ( 86f ) today for the fourth day in a row .
author: Adam Jinkerson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: graveyard to get £ 300,000 facelift
text: a graveyard in wisbech is getting a facelift worth more than £ 300,000 , thanks to the heritage lottery fund ( hlf ) .
the victorian-era wisbech cemetery is one of the few burial places for religious nonconformists in the country .
opened in 1836 , the graveyard , one of the very first garden cemeteries , is the final resting place for more than 6,500 people .
it 's unconsecrated ground , meaning people could have funerals regardless of their beliefs .
but in recent years the site has been neglected .
a grant of £ 303,000 from the hlf aims to put windows and a roof on the chapel , turning it into a visitors centre , as well as digitising a record of the burials .
david crouch , the project manager , said the revamp was `` important for wisbech because of the history '' .
`` it 's also important due to the interest that this area gets from people that are visiting wisbech or living and working here . ''
author: Louise Hubball
BBC Look East

documents.title: highways 'sorry for any inconvenience ' during works
text: highways england has issued a statement in regards to the works on the a1 slip road at junction 17 , which have clogged up routes around peterborough .
in the statement , it says that `` the work is needed as the surface on this busy road is reaching the end of its serviceable life '' .
it added : `` we are not just resurfacing this stretch but restoring the road surface as new , which will help minimise the need for maintenance for a long time once work has been completed .
`` we publicised this vital work in advance and are making sure that any restrictions are accurately reported through traffic information .
`` we understand that work on this scale can cause some disruption and apologise for any inconvenience caused .
we are installing some additional electronic message signs in the area to make extra sure that drivers are informed . ''
author: Adam Jinkerson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: bus operator says it was 'not aware ' of roadworks
text: the managing director of bus operator stagecoach has expressed his frustration at the lack of communication surrounding roadworks which have closed the entry slip road on to the a1 at junction 17 , causing major tailbacks through peterborough .
andy campbell , who runs the company , said the operator `` did n't know anything about it '' .
`` the first we were aware of it was saturday morning when i got a call from a supervisor saying that services were running an hour late , '' he said .
`` it 's terrible , but there 's very little you can do to mitigate it .
it 's probably the only way out of peterborough if you 're going south .
`` the thing that frustrates me a little bit is that i understand the work has to be done , but could they not have done the slip road at the weekend . ''
stagecoach has just tweeted that it expects more delays to services today
# b service due to rd works in peterboro we are still experiencing delays through yaxley .
service b will be affected .
apologies in advance .
author: Adam Jinkerson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: second day of peterborough jams as drivers suffer long queues
text: for the second day in a row there are major traffic problems around peterborough due to roadworks on the entry slip road to the a1 at haddon .
traffic is backing up along a15 london road through yaxley as drivers look to divert past the jams .
many people contacted bbc radio cambridgeshire about the problems yesterday , with some complaining that a 40-minute journey took two hours to complete .
part of the issues yesterday seemed to be not only be the a1 works , but a separate set of roadworks on the diversion route , organised by peterborough city council .
the council have confirmed that those will be suspended for the time being in a hope that it will help ease the congestion .
highways england say the slip road roadworks are set to last 24/7 for the next two weeks .
# a15 london road s/b # yaxley delays of around 25 minutes due to diverted traffic from # a1m slip rd closure # peterborough .
author: Adam Jinkerson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: another warm and sunny day
text: another hot , sunny and dry day across the bbc east region , but there will be a little more cloud for some parts .
inland temperatures are expected to reach between 27c and 30c ( 80f-86f ) - although it will be cooler on the coast .
tonight will be warm , with temperatures ranging between 14c and 17c ( 57f-62f ) .

documents.title: stranded deer rescued by boat
text: a stranded muntjac had to be rescued by fire crews over the weekend after it became stuck on the mud bank in the river nene near wisbech , with the tide rising .
using a rescue sled , firefighters were able to capture the deer , which was then checked over by the rspca .
although a bit shocked and soggy , the deer was in good health and later released .
author: Adam Jinkerson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: doctor is jailed for lying on cv
text: doctor is jailed for lying on cv

documents.title: man avoids jail after lying to police about crashed car
text: a man who tried to claim his sports car had been stolen after his friend crashed it into a ditch has avoided jail .
james hart had allowed a friend to drive his black aston martin vantage , which is worth more than £ 40,000 .
the car was crashed and abandoned on the bank of a dyke on march road near wisbech .
the friend was only covered by third party insurance which hart discovered when he called his insurance company .
the 68-year-old from march then contacted police and reported it stolen .
he was arrested for perverting the course of justice , which he pleaded guilty to last month .

he was sentenced to 15 months imprisonment , suspended for 24 months , ordered to undertake 25 days of rehabilitation activity , had a curfew imposed on him between 18:00 and 06:00 for four months and was ordered to pay £ 1,200 in costs at cambridge crown court .
pc matt smart said : `` hart has not gone to prison , but he will have the prospect of prison hanging over him for two years , as well as the curfew and costs .
`` he took a risk and when it went wrong he tried to get out of it by lying .
`` however , there was clear evidence the car had not been stolen .
`` we have had other cases where people have falsely claimed their cars have been stolen , so i hope this demonstrates how seriously it is treated . ''
author: Adam Jinkerson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : cardboard boat race takes over cam
text: hundreds of spectators watched cambridge university 's cardboard boat race
author: Adam Jinkerson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: ambulance service dealt with 7,200 emergency calls over weekend
text: as the mercury rose across the region during the weekend the east of england ambulance service was inundated .
staff received more than 7,200 emergency calls and patients experiencing falls , which were believed to be heat-related , were up 35 % .
two men were treated after collapsing at a triathlon event in waveney on sunday and sent crews to church lane in fritton .
a man in his 30s and a man in his 50s were reported to have collapsed .
they were treated at the scene before being taken to james paget university hospital for further care .
both were described as being in a stable condition .
the ambulance service received 21 further calls on sunday relating to heat exposure , including incidents in westcliff-on-sea , maldon , hemel hempstead , wroxham , cambridge , norwich and thetford .
`` our advice to people is to keep out of the sun during the hottest part of the day , wear sunscreen if you are going outdoors and keep hydrated , '' a spokesman said .
the ambulance service , which covers bedfordshire , hertfordshire , essex , norfolk , suffolk and cambridgeshire , said that saturday was its busiest day of the year so far .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: the cambridge bumps
text: the cambridge bumps

documents.title: 'rotting flesh ' smelling plant set to flower
text: a rare `` corpse flower '' that produces the `` stench of rotting flesh '' is set to bloom in the next week .
the titan arum is housed at cambridge university botanic garden .
it emits its nasty smell to attract pollinators and it is particularly pungent at night , when it heats itself up to about 40c ( 104f ) .
a different titan arum attracted more than 11,000 visitors when it bloomed in 2015 .
we 'll keep you updated on its progress .
our # titanarum has grown 20cm since saturday .
the countdown to flowering has started !
# returnofthetitan @ twitterid

documents.title: crash near soham
text: luckily no-one was seriously injured when these two vehicles crashed on the a142 near to soham earlier this morning .
police say they were called at around 07:40 to the collision near to the roundabout with fordham road .
two people were taken to hospital .
no-one was was arrested as a result of the incident .
author: Adam Jinkerson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: trains running slowly to save rails from 'buckling in heat '
text: train services on the london line from towns and cities across the region have been reduced to one per hour in each direction .
kerry worrall from greater anglia told the bbc the move was necessary because trains had to run slowly to protect equipment .
`` network rail put these restrictions in place when high temperatures are expected , '' she said .
`` as trains go over the rails at high speed they can apply great pressure that could cause the metal to buckle .
`` there is also the problem of overhead wires sagging .
`` to run trains more slowly means that the railway infrastructure is protected better . ''
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: mother of corrie mckeague says granddaughter is 'beautiful '
text: the mother of missing airman corrie mckeague has described her newly-born granddaughter as `` beautiful '' .
as we 've been reporting , the airman 's girlfriend april oliver announced the birth of their baby girl by posting a photograph on facebook on father 's day .
she was born on 11 june .
nicola urquhart , corrie 's mother , who has released the above exclusively to the bbc , said : `` baby is beautiful and very healthy .
`` we are so proud of april and how well she has coped with the stresses put on her during her pregnancy and fully support april in her wish to as much privacy as possible . ''
she added no interviews or further photos will be released .
`` we pray that others will respect this and not try to keep baby or april in the media , '' she said .
miss oliver revealed she was pregnant in january , four months after mr mckeague , from fife , vanished on a night out in bury st edmunds on 24 september .
police are continuing to search through the landfill site at milton near cambridge as part of their missing person inquiry .

documents.title: missing airman 's mother welcomes birth of his girlfriend 's baby
text: a facebook page dedicated to finding missing airman corrie mckeague has welcomed the birth of his baby daughter .
mr mckeague 's mother nicola urquhart said : `` we have finally welcomed this beautiful little lady into the world .
`` she is absolutely perfect .
i am so very proud of april for getting her here safely .
`` both mummy and baby are doing well .
thank you so much for all your love and support x x x '' .
april oliver , 21 , from downham market in norfolk , announced on father 's day that she had given birth to the baby .
mr mckeague , who is 23 years old and from fife , vanished after a night out with friends in bury st edmunds on 24 september 2016 .
a search for his remains is under way at a landfill site at milton near cambridge .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: roadworks cause problems across peterborough
text: earlier we reported that roadworks , which have closed the entry slip road to the a1 southbound at haddon , are causing gridlock around peterborough .
three hours later , the problems are still ongoing .
traffic is diverting through hampton and yaxley , which is causing disruption on surrounding roads .
stagecoach says some bus services are reporting 40 minute delays
serpentine green shopping centre says some shops may be late opening
have you been caught up in the jams this morning ?

author: Adam Jinkerson

documents.title: finsbury park attack : muslim council of peterborough 'saddened '
text: you may have seen news this morning that a man has died and 10 people have been injured after a van was driven into worshippers near a north london mosque .
in response , the muslim council of peterborough has issued a statement , saying it is `` extremely saddened at the mindless attack '' .

the statement continues : `` whilst we urge the muslim community to remain calm in the midst of the many sad incidents that have taken place , over the course of the last few weeks , we would also like to remind muslims throughout the community , of all the work that is being carried out by the various faith organisations , to promote integration and a better understanding of our faith , as well as the hard work being undertaken , to prevent and mitigate islamophobia within the united kingdom .
`` we are , as ever , grateful and praise the tireless bravery shown by the emergency services . ''
for more updates on this story , follow the dedicated live page live page here .
author: Adam Jinkerson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: why does a summer heatwave cause problems on the railways ?

it 's all to do with the metal rail lines expanding in the heat , creating a risk of buckling .

documents.title: extra ambulance staff called in as soaring temperature boosts 999 calls
text: extra staff were called in to work over the weekend as the east of england ambulance service struggled to cope with the volume of 999 calls caused by people reacting badly to the heat .
the hot weather , where temperatures reached 32c ( 95f ) in places , was the major factor in a huge boost to emergency calls , an ambulance service spokesman said .
emergency calls came from many people who had collapsed in the heat , were dehydrated and were elderly or struggling to cope .
the ambulance service , which covers bedfordshire , hertfordshire , essex , norfolk , suffolk and cambridgeshire , said that saturday was its busiest day of the year so far .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News
